reviewText:
Worth it on sale or if you want a slightly better looking FS13. Definately worth it if you want to be drunk near farm machinary and not have to worry about losing an arm.

FS15 is a decent refresh of FS13, the new shaders are definately a visual improvement on the equipment. Forestry is a nice addition. That said, it is still full of hilarious FarmSimulator-esque physics issues and minor annoyances from lack of attention-to-detail (like the Log trailer doesn't unload correctly at the designed depot, so why bother with it?). While the tractors/equipment look great, the stock buildings and terrain/enviroment lighting continue to look as drab as they did in FS13. Custom mod/map support still is present (as it was in FS13), however it's also obvious it's setup for future DLCs (for pay?).

reviewText:
Farming SImulator 15 is hands down the best one yet, and ive played since the first one. Now this comes in many new ways. One the HUD of everything has changed, from the start menu to the ingame HUD, though you still need a mod to hide it. The in game sounds seem more smooth, not on a loop as much which is nice. The graphics is the biggest improvement. Everything looks shaper and better in everyway. The dirt overhaul seemed to be my favorite part. How when you drive through fields you get dirt on your tractor, thus making you have to powerwash it off, very cool. Also granted some equipment was missing, (One i noticed was the sprayer machine that drove itself, as now you only get sprayer attachments) but more default equipment was added (without requiring payed expansions) such as tractor trailers and flatbeds, a truck to drive around it, more tractotrs and different types of equipment (such as more diverse range of plow lengths, or now the potato pull behind harvestor does a greater witdth of harvest) New companies were added, and the another big add on was logging. Though, the logging does seem really buggy still, I haven't successfully been able to cut down trees into trunks without having them spaz out, but its new. Once it gets perfected, it will be a great, unexecpted fun to Farming SIm. Also i liked the use of first person items ! (this game did alot of new updates that putting them all together perfect the game) But between the powerwasher and chainsaw, you get a more of a first person feel to the game. All in all, I would absolutley recommend this game. To people that have played it before, and enjoyed it, you will love this one, and to new comers to the farming world, if you have any interest, this game is for you.


PS

There is also a driving on dirt" system in the game now
date: making you drift as if you were on dirt
recommended: using the pickup going 50mph across a field sideways is hands down amazing. Everytime i walk past my truck in the game (ALSO you can change the colors of some of the equipment
hoursPlayed: the truck being one) i take it drifting across the fields."

This game is a trap. I thought I'll get bored quickly but there is always something to do . Cultivate sow harvest and then in between you can do forestry , cut grass for silage . And the reasons behind all the work is so you can get new machines that can let you do other things.

You start with basic equipment for wheat /barley/canola . If you want to grow corn, beets and potatoes you need either a header (corn) or a whole set  specialized equipment.

You don't have to do everything manually you can hire workers to do most of the field work. Either that or play multiplayer and get your friends/strangers  to do the work.

Other than that there are a lot of mods that add mostly farming equipment  for looks and functionality. There is also a mod called “course play” which let your hired work" do more complex things than vanila version.

Crane control in game can be challenging and some people really hate the wood chipper because of it. I just use an Xbox 360 controller for simultaneous 5 axis control and deal with it. I don't like “game breaking mods” . If it seems too good to be true it is.

If you value your time stay away from this game."

reviewText:
Alright... So, Farming simulator 2015 is a farming game (No surprise there) Where you can: Harvest crops, Raise cows and other farming stuff. Its fairly fun... At least, when it works.

The DLC is abundant and extremely overpriced. You may get a couple of vehicles or a couple of attachments. And to be honest the amount you get from each pack is surprisingly low... I would happily pay 75% of retail price for it but for its full price I think its just a money grab.

The multiplayer is utterly terrible. If you have a poor connection it is nearly impossible to steer properly. The client often freezes while moving and will reset your velocity which is very frustrating. And as previously stated makes steering and maneuvering difficult. Loading is extremely annoying. When connecting its really  luck based. Sometimes it may connect but usually it doesn't. And when you actually manage to connect it takes forever to load and once you finish loading you end up with this weird player sync thing that takes ages and the entire server freezes the entire time during this process.

Physics in this game are nearly non existent. When getting out of vehicles you can glitch through walls. Grabbing logs and bales is difficult. Getting bales on and off bale forks can be glichy and difficult. Tools often glitch through the ground when attaching to them and it can be difficult to get them out of the ground. Wheel friction is a little funny and you rarely have proper traction.

As for content I feel this game is lacking without overpriced dlc. There are only two maps and only a couple of vehicle brands. And I feel like certain categories such as road tractors and lowboys are extremely lacking. The maps seem small and the layouts are confusing. It is also difficult to get up the hills with large loads because of the wheel friction. The ai on the roads is just frustrating and isn't programmed well. I have had cars turn into me at an intersection many times.

The modding community is riddled with unfinished, broken, and stolen mods. However there are also many well made and good mods. Another problem that I have found is that mods in multiplayer are extremely annoying. You have to find every mod that is on the server before you can join which can be a tedious and slow process. Other than that mods can add allot of what the dlc does to the game and add alot more variety.

So, In conclusion I bought this game during the christmas sales and I have enjoyed it to an extent. Do I think it is worth the money? No, I personally don't believe that at full retail price this game is worth the cost given all of its problems. Would I buy it on sale? Possibly but now that I have seen its problems I am not so sure.

As for fs 2017? I feel that if I don't see alot of improvement in the netcode and physics I don't plan on purchasing it.

TL: DR Buy something else

Also for those complaining about me having poor specs and how that affects my game... My computer is running a q8400 @2.66 ghz, Gtx 750ti (Manualy overclocked) and 8 gigs of ddr3 ram. Yes, It isn't the best computer but it runs fs at max settings with no lag.

reviewText:
Being a fan of fs2011 and 2013 I can say that this game has been improved by no end. I wont go into the improved graphics and engine as this has been covered by many. There are some niggly little things that could and/or may be addressed in patches (such as only one cruise control speed as opposed to 4 in 2013) and logging machines being a little bit awkward to use  - the chipper being nigh impossible.

However, before reading any negative comments please note that most people who are saying its too easy are playing on 'easy' difficulty or making changes in the XML files to cheat. Like many games it pays to make your own rules in your own head - i want to clear all these logs" or " that field needs to be join to that one"

8/10 great game"

reviewText:
Nice improvements over FS2013, much better physics and graphics are nicer too, it's nice to see several mods built into the game now (I won't name them see if you can figure out which ones they are).  GIANTS have also drastically improved the beacons lighting effect & resolved issues from 2013.

The game SHINES when you finally manage to get yourself the Scorpion King, its a joy to use and very satisfying, defo the icing on the cake.

Overall I am pleased with this release, however I would of liked to see interactive cabs and more dials respresenting actual performance of the machine but Im just nit-picking here.

Nice to see MODS being released after DAY 2 :)

SCORE: 8.7 / 10

reviewText: Great game and SO under rated. Not only did they improve all the partical effects, graphics etc. from 2013, they added more and more vehicles to use and equipment which keeps the game interesting and still fun. ALSO, apart from the traditional farming... they added LOGGING. You literally get to drive around in a big machine with a scorpion like arm and cut a tree...strip its branches and bark and chop it into whatever size piece you would like, then throw it into a wood chipper or load it up and take it to sell it. Its simply just... awesome. If you are into games that require lots of time and patience as well as cool concepts, or just want to try something different, this is it.\n\n10/10, would buy again. Highly Recommended.

reviewText:
Unfortunately, I just can't quite recommend this game. If there were a star rating, I'd give it a pretty neutral rating, but since there's no inbetween option, it gets a no. Here's why:

Cons for the game

- Very little help/ instructions. Almost none at all. This is the single biggest reason for the low rating. After all of the effort put into making this game, you couldn't add an extra couple lines of text? One example, balers. There are 2 types of bales in the game, each made from it's own baler. There is no description as to which kind of bale each machine makes, you just have to know. There are also machines and trailers that interact with these 2 different types of bales. Do these other machines specify which type of bale they work on? Nope! Of course not! Because adding a single line of text, even just a 2 word xxxx Bale" discription would be too much work. Another example is a harvester
date: the Mex 5. I bought it when I had a little extra money and tried to figure out what it's for since
hoursPlayed: there was no description saying how to use it. I tried cutting different things and no results. Finally I had to look it up online to get an answer.\n\n-Very "hands on"
voteText: you can hire workers for some tasks but not many. Alot of the jobs
helpfulPercent: including what I would consider to be some of the most boring
votesHelpful: you cannot hire a worker for. Why? Again
votesTotal: given the scope of the game
votesFunny: would it really be that much harder to implement a feature that you already made on some other duties? Example
commentsCount: you can hire workers for some harvesters but not others. Beet farming looks like it would be the most profitable use of a field
column16: but it takes 10x the work since you cannot hire workers to harvest them until you buy one of the single most expensive machines in the game. Instead you have to sit in the tractor yourself
column17: with one of the narrowest harvester heads in the game. It took half an hour to harvest one of the smallest fields
column18: compared to the under 10 minutes of letting a paid worker do it for me
column19: and I only make about 2x the money. Of course even then beets take up much more room
column21: so that means 3x the trips from the field to the market where you are selling them.\n\nI suppose those are the only cons that come to mind for me. However
column22: they are nearly game breaking in my opinion. You can *almost* play this as a management game
column24: but too much of the game requires you to actively control the machinery. Also spending hours
column26: trying to figure out what the machinery does because they could not be bothered to add a description
column27:
is just rediculous.

Pros:

... well I wouldn't say there are any
column28: just some middleground "okay" things. Decent or better graphics
column29: though graphics are pretty low on my scale of what makes a game "good". Some jobs can be given to workers
column30: allowing you to do other things
column31: or even nothing if you want
column33: that's about it in the plus columb for me."

reviewText:
Farming Simulator 15 is the first Farming Simulator I've played. While I have to say I'm somewhat impressed with the graphics, parts of the game are repetitive, such as taking crops to sell, or tilling a field. You can hire farm workers to do these jobs if you have enough money or your equipment is efficient enough.

All in all, I'd say it's fairly entertaining, especially for someone like me who knows little about farming or the equipment involved. I was also surprised ot find a large part of the game is more like forrestry simulator, though I guess technically you can farm trees.

Also, keep in mind, this is Farming Simulator" not "Farm Simulator."  I was personally disappointed
date: after my first long day behind the manure spreader
hoursPlayed: I wasn't able to go home and knock my wife's remaining teeth out or commit incest. You can't even go inside your farm house.\n\nIf you're looking for a simulation of farm life

reviewText: Perhaps the Very Best Simulator game out there. It's very in depth in the field management with abilities to expand into other areas of farming like tree farming, green houses, and even solar/wind farming. The game can be played solely as a crop farm, tree farm, animal farm, or as all types above. There's also a very active modding community which the game developers seem to pay attention to and add popular things to the game in updates and/or DLC.
voteText: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
What a great, different and fun gaming experience. If you grew up around farms this game will bring back some good memories. It is also great to enjoy together with your friends or on your own when you are running a successful business in singleplayer. I especially enjoy the high quality of the 3D models within the game.

I would highly suggest to look up the many free (!) mods for this game created by the community (vehicles, maps, placeables, game improvements, ...) - They really expand the gaming experience and give you a lot of new equipment to try out!

Some minor cons I have found:

- The ambient AI traffic is a little bit awkward in its behavior.
- For high-end computers the graphic settings are too basic and restricted. (Tip: You can greatly extend draw, view and shadow distance by manually editing settings in the mapXX.i3d files found in the game folder using the Notepad. This should really be an option to edit using the in-game menu, though!)
- Even though I don't operate real tractors, the acceleration feels a little bit too intense and fast. Steering could also feel a little bit 'heavier'.

Besides these, I really love the game and I especially like the community supporting it with great mods!

reviewText:
Do you need to relax, decompress just get unstressed?
Then this is a nice game to play for awhile.
Very relaxing, stress-free game, easy to play, and believe it or not, very enjoyable.
Over 1,000 hours played on Farming Simulator 2013 and couldn't wait for this one to come out.
Beware, there are a few bugs still at the moment, but nothing major that impairs game playability.

Think it's crazy to play a farming simulator?
Yeah, that's what I thought also, until I tried it and have really enjoyed the game ever since.
I'd be willing to bet if you sit down and do the tutorials and play for 30-60 minutes, you'll end up playing it and enjoying it.
It's mod-able and there are plenty of mods out there already, from various tractors to implents and trailers.
As the modders add more, the game exapnds from just being a first player sim to also include multiple field farm mangement with hired workers via scripts.

Give  it a try. If you go to the Farming Simulator main website, you can download a demo for Farm Sim 2013 and give it a try before you buy.
voteText: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
EDIT: Changed review, see notes below.

It was fun right up until I decided to do forestry. Then it went horribly wrong. Spent hours trying to get a tree into the wood chipper. It was like there was an invisble block in the way. I'm not the only one either, based on forum posts I've read. It's just not worth the amount of time I spent trying to figure it out. The rest of it is fun enough, but I can tell already that it will become a massive grind for very little point.

Overall, I can't recommend it, to be honest. If, however, you're hard core into simulators then I'd at least suggest you wait for a really good sale.

UPDATE: After playing some more, and finding a couple of forestry mods I am changing this to a recommend. The recent patch helped as well. Check around for various mods, they enhance the experience quite a bit.

reviewText: Their isn't much to this game. It's very low stress and relaxing. Put on some tunes, plow your fields, milk your cows or whatever you want to do to earn money. Then buy better equipment or more plots of land. Rinse and repeat. Logging will earn you the most money by far of anything you can do, however it's pretty buggy, at least it is on my end. I have to save and save often. I even have a tree that I had to leave on the ground  (part of it is actually hovering in mid air) because I was unable to move it once I sawed it in segments. So be careful with that. I have not tried The Scorpion yet, but the controls on the basic logging equipment took me the better part of two hours to hang of. I've pretty much just giving up on logging despite the money, and only use it as a supplemental income to pay for my labor costs and let my fields and livestock be my main source of income. If you're looking for a low stress fun little game and something that's very kid friendly this is it.

reviewText:
As a child, I used to help out in a pre-industrial peasant village, where every single farming task was done by hand in the scorching sun. This had given me an intense fear of agriculture.

This simulator, with its depiction of convenient and powerful modern farming implements, has given me the chance to steadily face my fears and learn to cope with it.

I cannot recommend this game enough.

reviewText:
As a child, I used to help out in a pre-industrial peasant village, where every single farming task was done by hand in the scorching sun. This had given me an intense fear of agriculture.

This simulator, with its depiction of convenient and powerful modern farming implements, has given me the chance to steadily face my fears and learn to cope with it.

I cannot recommend this game enough.

reviewText:
This game is absolutely amazing running you're own farm driving tractors about and other vehicles.

This game is repetetive but what do you think us real farmers do lol, if you are a real farmer this is a good game to play.

You can add mods which is pretty cool i added a couple of different mods my favourite being the massey ferguson 8737.

I might not have as many hours as most people only becuase i work and play on different games with freinds but this is a great solo game or multiplayer what ever suits you i guess.

But this is my review and i hope you enjoy this game as much as i did :)

reviewText:
Not just 'not recommended' but 'HIGHLY Not recommended'

This was my first exposure to this franchise, and figured it would enjoy the support and growth of its previous installments.
It does not.  The game is IDENTICAL to the day it was released and lacks some key features one would expect of a 'Farming Business' game.  There have been a few DLCs released for purchase, but they ONLY contain more of the same equipment or mabe in the future a new map.  No new functionality!

There is a large modding community, but byand large from what I can see they never moved on to FS15, choosing to stay with previous FS...which I can understand as the games are pretty well identical except for logging.  As such the modding community for FS15 is pretty much just specialized equipment and a few handy mods for field management.  But no large scale overhauls to introduce anything you would associate with a 'Farming Simulator' such as need for any Herbicide, crop rotation, soil quality, or even an effect of weather on harvesting or planting.

Seriously.  Just skip this one.

reviewText:
The idea of this game is good. But it's engine is terrible. Worst engine ever for a simulator.

It's impossible to say this game is a SIM, they should remove this part of their game's name. The tractors can't be damaged, the physics are terrible. If you turn over one of your vehicles they just straight up for themselves.

Please devs, strip simulator out of this game's name and put something like Farming Managing 2015. There is no simulation whatsoever in this game.
